abstract.text: An authentication flow that implements the Okta Direct Authentication API.

inlineContent.text: This enables developers to build native sign-in workflows into their applications, while leveraging MFA to securely authenticate users, without the need to present a browser. Furthermore, this enables passwordless authentication scenarios by giving developers the power to choose which primary and secondary authentication factors to use when challenging a user for their credentials.
You can create an instance of
with your client settings, or you can use one of several convenience initializers to simplify the process.

code: // Start authentication with a user's chosen factor.
// Sign in successful with 1FA, so store the token.
// MFA required, so challenge the user.
// Sign in successful with 2FA, so store the token.

inlineContent.text: The above example uses Swift Concurrency, since these asynchronous methods can be used inline easily. However block-based functions are available for all asynchronous operations.
Authentication factors are separated into two groups:
– Used for initial authentication when calling
– Used for supplying additional MFA factors, with the
Each of the fuctions using these factors returns an instance of
, which indicates whether or not authentication is successful, or if multiple factors are required.

topicSections.title: Starting MFA or signing in with 1FA

DirectAuthFlowChart.alt: Flowchart describing the Direct Authentication workflow.

abstract.text: Authenticate users using Okta’s Direct Authentication API, enabling native sign-in experiences supporting Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
An authentication flow that implements the Okta Direct Authentication API.
Configuration which can be used to customize the authentication flow, as needed.
Enumeration defining the list of possible authenticator “Continuation” factors, which are used.
The type of authentication continuation that is requested.
Indicates the intent for the user authentication operation.
Context information used to define a request from the server to perform a multifactor authentication.
Channel used when authenticating an out-of-band factor using Okta Verify.
Enumeration defining the list of possible primary authentication factors.
Enumeration defining the list of possible secondary authentication factors.
The current status of the authentication flow.
Any additional query string parameters you would like to supply to the authorization server for all requests from this flow.
The OAuth2Client this authentication flow will use.
The context that stores the state for the current authentication session.
Initializer to construct an authentication flow from a pre-defined configuration and client.
Convenience initializer to construct an authentication flow from variables.
Indicates whether or not this flow is currently in the process of authenticating a user.
Resets the authentication session.
Resumes authentication when an additional (secondary) factor is required to verify the user.
Continues authentication of a current factor (either primary or secondary) when an additional step is required.
Continues authentication of a current factor (either primary or secondary) when an additional step is required.
Resumes authentication when an additional (secondary) factor is required to verify the user.
Start user authentication, with the given username login hint and primary factor.
Start user authentication, with the given username login hint and primary factor.
The list of grant types the application supports.
Delegate protocol used by
